generalInfo:
Discover Kosovo - Europe’s newest, most fascinating country! This unique adventure week mixes outdoor activities like cave trekking, hiking and kayaking with cultural experiences embedded in community and tradition.

A must-visit for anyone in search of intrigue and adventure, Kosovo is far from the mainstream and right on target for those who prefer their holidays wild and mysterious! Our local guides will introduce you to spectacular waterfalls and limestone peaks, breath-taking views, deep canyons, colourful wildflowers, medieval villages, historic cities, mosques, monasteries and a rich, welcoming culture that is second to none.

NB – this is a small group holiday suitable for couples, families and groups of friends and requires a decent level of physical fitness. Our recommended minimum age is 8.

dayInfo.description: Arrival: Arrival day and meeting with your Tour Leader at Prishtina (PRN) international airport. They will answer questions, brief you on the immediate arrangements and then transport us to the Rugova mountain region for accommodation. Depending on the arrival time we’ll stop for a visit at city of Peja. Overnight in Chalet Kujta.

Liqenati Mountain lakes hike: After breakfast we’ll take a short transport 35min up to the starting point of Te Liqeni restaurant and start to hike towards the Liqenati Mountain Lakes. We will walk through a pine forest and open mountainous terrain towards mountain lakes 1790m above sea level. We can spend some time at the lakes exploring the flora and fauna around the lake (there are lake salamanders and newts aplenty!), and there will also be time to swim for those who wish to leap into the lake’s waters. Then it’s back to the starting point, stopping by at the locally renowned fairy waterfall trail. Dinner and free evening. Hike duration: 3-4 hours. Level: moderate. Overnight at Chalet Kujta.

Accursed Mountains 4x4 Tour: After breakfast we will drive through the Jezera canyon towards the Milisheci mountain ridge reaching 2200m above sea level to have scenic and panoramic views of the Prokletije, the accursed mountains peaks, including the highest peak in Kosovo – Gjeravica (2656m) – where we will have a barbeque lunch with panoramic views. For the adventurous, there is also the option to climb the 450m Via Ferrata in Rugova canyon (at extra cost)! Back to Rugova mountain guesthouse for a free evening. Overnight at Chalet Kujta.

Sleeping Beauty Cave Adventure: Today we will visit White Drini natural park, located 11km north of the city of Peja. Our destination is the biggest waterfall in Kosovo and the region, White Drini spring and the magnificent Sleeping Beauty Cave – at 3650m long, it’s the second biggest cave in Kosovo, well known for 8 different species of bats! We will have lunch at one of the restaurants located by the river, best known for trout fish specialties and traditional dishes. After lunch we will visit the 160 year old water mill run by many generations from the same family in Radaci village before returning to Rugova mountain village for a free evening. Overnight at Chalet Kujta.

Kayaking and Bear Sanctuary visit: In the morning after breakfast we will head towards the capital Prishtina for a kayaking adventure at Batllava Lake. This version of our classic paddling expedition brings you the quieter and more remote portion of the lake – it’s great for swimming too! An artificial lake originally created to supply Prishtina with drinking water, it now supports several species of water birds and gives us the chance to try out sit on top and sit-inside kayaking. The nearby Bear Sanctuary is refuge for over 20 rescued European brown bears, sadly critically endangered at the moment. The sanctuary is a 16 hectare haven for these amazing creatures – and we can also have a lunch at their on-site restaurant! Head towards city of Prizren for accommodation and free evening. Overnight in Prizren.

Prizren visit and optional silver jewellery-making workshop: A day to rest up before the major hike of the program. Take in the sights of Prizren, with its diverse and fascinating history! Here, we recommend an optional hands-on workshop at a silversmith's, where you can learn the basics of the silver-jewellery making tradition Prizren is renowned for in the Balkan region (perfect for adults and kids). Overnight in Prizren.

Sharr Mountain hike: Spanning from central Kosovo to the southern border with Macedonia, the Sharr Mountains offer some of Kosovo’s most beautiful hiking routes and are home to a diverse array of flora and fauna and a wealth of 2500+ metre peaks to explore! It’s an early start as this looped hike will take 6-8 hours to complete, gaining over 900m of elevation to reach the summit of Vraca e Madhe (2582 metres). On your way back, you will have an excellent view of Mt. Korab, the region’s highest mountain, which forms the border between Kosovo, Macedonia, and Albania. Overnight in Prizren.

tourName: North Albania and Kosovo guided tour
placesVisited: Sofia, Melnik, Pirin Mountains, Tikvesh vineyards, Bitola, Pelister National Park, Ohrid, Galicica National Park, Kalishta and Radozda villages, Skopje, Prizren
generalInfo: Northern Albania and Kosovo deliver big views and even bigger stories. Led by an expert local tour leader, you’ll witness striking architecture, explore dramatic natural beauty and uncover centuries-old traditions. What truly sets this adventure apart, however, is the chance to connect with local people and hear their stories – an authentic insight into daily life and recent history, including a moving exploration of the Kosovo War.

dayInfo.description: Begin your adventure in Tirana, the trendy capital of Albania. At 6pm, say përshëndetje (hello) to your tour leader and fellow travellers at our hotel, where we gather as a group to get to know each other a little more and learn about the adventures ahead. After, we embark on a walking tour of the city centre, hitting major landmarks, including Skanderbeg Square, Et’hem Bey Mosque and the Pyramid of Tirana. Your tour leader then ensures a big Albanian welcome by arranging a group dinner. Want to explore Tirana further? Secure pre-tour hotel nights through your sales representative. Accommodation: Golden City Hotel/Sky 2 Hotel (or similar)

Bid farewell to Tirana this morning and take a scenic transfer (1hr 20min) to Kulla Hupi, a traditional stone house that once served as a fortified home. Here, we enjoy a snack while learning about the 200-year history of Kulla Hupi. After, we continue (one hour) to Rabdisht, a traditional stone village that has earned a reputation for serving delicious local dishes. Sample these flavours with lunch at a guesthouse. Next, we go even deeper into the local produce with a tour of the Kopfrut factory, where we learn all about how they create apple juice, offering an insight into the local agriculture. After, we continue to the town of Peshkopi, where we have the evening free to explore. Accommodation: Hotel Veri/MontBlanc (or similar)

Transfer (30 minutes) to Shumbat, a village known for producing rakia, a traditional fruit brandy in the Balkans. Here, we take a tour, seeing daily life play out and enjoy a sampling of rakia. Next, we travel (25 minutes) to Radomire, gateway to the Korab mountains. We take a refreshing walk (one hour) to Liqeni i Zi (Black Lake), enjoying the pristine nature, before returning to Radomire for coffee and a chance to soak in the serene atmosphere. For lunch, we eat at Zgara e Bushtrices, a restaurant renowned for serving delicious grilled meats, allowing us to enjoy a hearty Albanian lunch while gazing over the Korab mountains. Transfer (one hour) to Kukes after, a town that played a significant role during the Kosovo War, serving as a refuge for Kosovar Albanian refugees. Here, we join a local guide to explore concrete tunnels and bunkers built during the communist era to protect the residents. Our tour provides a sobering insight into the recent horrors suffered by the people. After, we travel to Prizren, Kosovo, with a free evening to explore the charming Old Town, walk along the Lumbardhi River, or enjoy dinner at one of the many excellent restaurants offering traditional Albanian and local cuisine. Accommodation: Hotel Centrum (or similar)

Depart Prizren and transfer (1hr 10min) to Prekaz. Here, we visit a deeply moving site, the Adem Jashari Memorial Complex. It’s dedicated to Adem Jashari and his family, who were killed in a brutal siege by Serbian forces in 1998. Their sacrifice became a pivotal moment and symbol of resistance leading to the Kosovo War. We take our time to explore the complex, which includes the remnants of the Jashari family homes, their graves, and a museum dedicated to their story. This extended visit allows for deeper reflection and understanding of this crucial period in Kosovo’s modern history. We continue our understanding of the period with a visit to Gazimestan, a memorial site commemorating the Battle of Kosovo, before visiting the tomb of Ottoman Sultan Murad I. Finally, we transfer (one hour) to Prishtina, the capital of Kosovo. After lunch, we enjoy a tour of the city, strolling along Mother Teresa Boulevard to soak up the atmosphere, and visiting some of the city landmarks, including the Newborn Monument, Cathedral of Saint Mother Teresa and government buildings. Accommodation: Emery Hotel/Hotel Afa/Hotel Begolli (or similar)

Today is dedicated to exploring the history of Kosovo. We bid farewell to Prishtina and transfer (30 minutes) to Gracanica Monastery, built by Serbian king Milutin in the 1300s. Its Serbo-Byzantine style is reason enough to visit but inside we can admire the medieval paintings and a cavern of murals. After, we head even further back in time, driving (less than five minutes) to Ulpiana Archaeological Park. Here, we explore what remains of the ancient Roman city of Ulpiana, founded in the second century, including a basilica, public baths and mosaics. After lunch, we travel (1hr 30min) to Peja Orthodox Monastery and Church, on the outskirts of Peja. Visually striking, it’s also an important religious institution as well as being the seat for the old Serbian empire. Guided by our tour leader, we explore the site and its fascinating history, before continuing our journey to our hotel. Accommodation: Hotel Dukagjini/Hotel Karagaq (or similar)

We head to Visoki Decani today, a medieval Serbian Orthodox monastery, to explore its intricate frescoes, and learn about its history and enduring importance. Continuing to Gjakova, we enjoy a tour of the Ottoman-era Çarshia (Old Bazaar). It’s one of the largest in the Balkans, with traditional shops, mosques and a rich history. There’s plenty to see, including the Hadum Mosque and old stone bridges, plus the artisans’ workshops. After tucking into a traditional local lunch in the bazaar, we drive (1hr 30min) to Valbona in Albania. Accommodation: Hotel Margjeka/Hotel Breezy (or similar)

After a one-hour transfer, we take a ferry across Lake Koman. This two-hour ride is a highlight of the trip, offering breathtaking views of the narrow, fjord-like lake surrounded by the dramatic peaks of the Albanian Alps. After, we travel (2hr-2hr 30min) to Mrizi i Zanave, a rustic field-to-fork restaurant in the middle of a farm. Celebrate our adventure together with an unforgettable meal that showcases traditional Albanian cuisine made with locally sourced ingredients. Full, we transfer (1hr 15min) to Rubik. Based in the old village, Katund i Vjeter, we have an evening at leisure to enjoy the peace and traditional Albanian architecture. Accommodation: Hotel Marub (or similar)

You’ve heard the peoples’ stories, tasted incredible cuisine, and enjoyed magnificent views but now it’s time to begin your return journey home. Alternatively, if you’d like to extend your adventure, speak to your sales representative to discuss our large range of extension options.
